title: Africa: Catalyzing Climate-Resilient Agriculture in Africa
description: [Africa Enterprise Challenge Fund] Considering how important agricultural systems are for providing food and jobs, it is crucial to protect these systems in Africa from the harm caused by climate change. This will help keep agriculture stable and working well to sustain households.

title: Africa: COP28 - Climate Experts Question Slow Progress in Adaptation Talks
description: [New Times] As the end of the first week of COP28 approaches, African Civil Society Organisations (CSOs) have raised a red flag on the progress of the Global Goal on Adaptation (GGA) negotiations, expressing fears that the process may not yield a concrete outcome.

title: Africa: Accelerating Investment in Community Health Workforce Programs in Africa
description: [Africa CDC] Recently, the Africa CDC participated in the first-ever COP28 Health Day in the United Arab Emirates on the sidelines of the Reaching the Last Mile Forum. The event aimed to renew the commitment to invest in and support professional community health workers (CHWs), who are essential frontline health workers.

title: Africa: AU Member States Validated the Teachers' Guides and Learners' Manuals Needed for the AU Strategy on Charter on Democracy, Elections and Governance
description: [African Union] African Union Member States Validation Meeting on the Teachers' Guides and Learners' Manuals needed for the AU Strategy for the inclusion and Mainstreaming of the African Charter on Democracy, Elections and Governance (ACDEG) in School Curricula was held in Maputo, Mozambique from 4 to 6 December 2023. The meeting was organized by the Constitutionalism and Rule of Law Unit under the Department of Political Affairs, Peace and Security, African Union Commission (AUC). The meeting brought together Member

title: Africa: Illicit Financial Flows, Debt Management, Cost of Capital, Dominate Discussions By African Economists
description: [African Union] African economists have kicked off a forum to examine what the continent must do to finance its development agenda efficiently and sustainably. The 6th Congress of African Economists which gathers African Economists from across the continent and the diaspora, will seek to deepen the understanding and analyze the implications of Illicit Financial Flows (IFFs) and the effectiveness of the debt management strategies employed at the national level. The congress is focused on ''Financing Africa's Development

title: Africa: WHO Releases Guidelines On Chronic Low Back Pain
description: [WHO] The World Health Organization (WHO) is releasing its first-ever guidelines on managing chronic low back pain (LBP) in primary and community care settings, listing interventions for health workers to use and also to not use during routine care.

title: Africa: Only Half of Young People Able to Identify Correct Definition of Climate Change - Unicef, Gallup
description: [Unicef] New York/Dubai -- Findings highlight urgent need to protect and invest in children, including in climate education, in decisions at COP28

title: Africa: Antarctica Lawyers Up - Hopes for a Legal Revolution to Defend Earth's Vast Southern Wilderness
description: [Daily Maverick] Global experts unite at COP28 to grant the world's greatest deep freeze far-reaching rights equal to humans.

title: Africa: Coalition for Women's Rights Calls Upon African Governments to Address Violations of Women's Rights
description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- The SOAWR Coalition, a consortium of over 70 women's rights organizations in 33 African countries dedicated to advocating for women's rights in Africa has launched a Call to Action and Accountability in harmony with the objectives of the 16 Days of Activism against Gender-Based Violence.

title: Africa: COP28 Declaration Seen As Good News for World's Small Farmers
description: [VOA] Dubai -- Agriculture and climate experts say there is good news for the world's small farmers in a declaration endorsed by 134 world leaders during the opening days of COP28, the global climate summit unfolding this month in Dubai.

title: Africa: Revolutionizing the Building Sector for Sustainable, Resilient Cities
description: [IPS] Dubai -- In the spirit of global cooperation and environmental commitment, COP 28 launched a groundbreaking initiative aimed at transforming the building and construction sectors. Titled 'Buildings and Construction for Sustainable Cities: New Key Partnerships for Decarbonization, Adaptation, and Resilience,' the initiative marks a turning point in addressing the environmental challenges posed by the construction industry.

title: Africa: WHO Africa Welcomes New Commitment By Global Partners to End Neglected Tropical Diseases
description: [WHO-AFRO] Brazzaville -- The fight against neglected tropical diseases (NTDs) has received a major boost with a landmark commitment by donors and partners to invest over US$ 777 million boost efforts to eliminate and eradicate NTDs.

title: Africa: Rural Communities Are Being Left Behind Because of Poor Digital Infrastructure, Research Shows
description: [The Conversation Africa] In an era where businesses and households depend on the internet for everything from marketing to banking and shopping, the lack of adequate digital access can be a significant hurdle. And our recent research shows that many homes and businesses in the UK are being left stranded in the digital age.

title: Africa: Guterres Urges Greater Support for UN Emergency Relief Fund
description: [UN News] Secretary-General António Guterres on Wednesday highlighted the importance of the UN's core humanitarian response fund to deploy quick and strategic resources to global crises globally.

title: Africa: Calls Grow to Reform UN Peacekeeping Missions
description: [DW] Africa has been a focal point for the United Nations peacekeeping missions for decades. For the first time, the continent has hosted a global ministerial meeting and urged the UN to reform its peacekeeping operations.

title: Africa: Opera, Glass Blowing, Poncho Weaving and More - Unesco Celebrates World's Cultural Heritage
description: [UN News] The UNESCO committee that protects so called Intangible Cultural Heritage met in Botswana this week to add new entries to the UN culture agency's list of world treasures, some of which must be "urgently" safeguarded.

title: Africa: Amid Rising Corruption, Most Africans Say They Risk Retaliation If They Speak Up
description: [Afrobarometer] Two-thirds of citizens say their government is doing a poor job of fighting graft.

title: Africa: Africa's Top Six Priorities At COP28
description: [Africa Renewal] Finance leads in Africa's asks at the ongoing global climate talks in Dubai

title: Africa: How Colonial Germany Extended Its Empire in Africa
description: [DW] By 1885, Adolf Lüderitz had acquired vast territories in today's Namibia. But his contracts with local people were so dodgy that even German colonial officials doubted them.

title: Africa: Beware Carbon Myopia At COP28 - Why Climate and Nature Action Must Now Come Together in the Race for a Liveable Planet
description: [IPS] New York -- As COP28 delegates focus on the first Global Stocktake, there is no doubt that the race to net-zero greenhouse gas emissions is vital.

title: Africa: Global Civil Society Launches Manifesto for Ethical AI
description: [IPS] New Dehli -- By Bibbi Abruzzini and Nina Sangma

title: Africa: Art and Climate Change
description: [IPS] Stockholm, Sweden -- A dark cloud is hovering above human existence. It is a fairly illusory cloud haunting our minds and wellbeing, but also an actual, menacing, mostly invisible cloud that covers the Earth's entire atmosphere. Saturated by greenhouse gases, this global threat increases with every year, threatening all life on Earth, causing increased flooding, extreme heat, draught, wild fires, rising sea levels, food and water scarcity, as well as diseases and mounting economic loss. This misery, caused by human greed,

title: Africa: Schrodinger's COP - How's Africa Faring At the Climate Talks At Halftime?
description: [African Arguments] Texts that will shape future climate action are still under fierce contestation. Some drafts contain the best case scenario for Africa alongside the worst.
